Verses.1: In the beginning was the Word, and the Word was with God, and the Word was God.
Verses.2: In the beginning He was with God.
Verses.3: Through Him all things came into being. And without Him, nothing that has ever existed, has come to be.
Verses.4: In Him was life, and that life was the Light of all peoples.
Verses.5: And that Light shines in the darkness, and the darkness did not subdue it.
Verses.6: There came another sent from God, and his name was John.
Verses.7: He came to be a witness, to testify about the Light, so that through him all might believe.
Verses.8: He was not the Light, rather he came to tell us about the Light.
Verses.9: That the true Light was coming into the world to enlighten everyone.
Verses.10: He was in the world, and creation was made through Him, yet creation did not know Him.
Verses.11: He came to His own people, and they rejected Him.
Verses.12: But to all who accept Him, to those who believed in His name, He gave them the right to become children of God.
Verses.13: Children who were not born of blood, nor the will of the flesh, nor of a person's will, but of God.
Verses.14: And the Word became flesh and lived among us, and we saw His glory. The glory of the only Son from the Father, full of grace and truth.
Verses.23: He said, "I am a voice of one crying out in the wilderness. 'Make straight the way of the Lord', as Isaiah the prophet said."

Changes: 2022-12-16 - Paul Prins: First translation of chapter 1:1-14.
2022-12-06 - Paul Prins: First translation of chapter 1:23.
